responses.comment: This was easier if you know dynamic programming concepts beforehand, but I had to learn how to write proofs.
I didn't know dynamic programming so this assignment was challenging for me.
Dynamic programming was new to me, but I went to OH early on so I eventually got it.
I had seen dynampic programming in interview prep before, so I didn't have to learn it from scratch.
This was awful – definitely go to class and pay as much attention as you can (oops)! Dynamic programming was new for me.
Yup, I think I'm dropping the class. I read the textbook, went to OH, spent a ton of time on the HW, but I just couldn't grasp dynamic programming.
I didn't know there would be two problems a week. One was really challenging, and the other easier, but by no means a walk in the park.
There was only one reduction problem this week, and it was easy since it was the first reductions assignment.
Although there was only one reduction problem this week, there was also a midterm, which stressed me out.
Phew! Only one problem this week (on reductions). I had been struggling with the other assignments.
Honestly, I spent more time writing up the proof than figuring out how to do the single reduction this week.
This was a nice relative break as the homework was lighter, but the midterm was also this week.
This was the first reductions homework, and this is the concept I've struggled the most with in this class so far.
This was a pretty chill homework, but I guess I already knew the fundamental OOP concepts from before.
This was my only second CS class since I just switched majors, so I'm still trying to figure things out. I hate semicolons!
I've been coding since middle school, so I already knew object-oriented programming.
Definitely manageable. The concept of classes made sense to me, but took more effort actually implementing something.
I loved doing this assignment! It was relatively challenging, but I felt like I learned a lot.
I skipped this class as an underclassman, but now I had to take as a senior to finish my requirements, so this was easy for me.
This was pretty straightforward, in my opinion. The assignment was on linked lists.
This was my first time dealing with pointers, so this was challenging to implement a linked list.
Challenging, but interesting. After the struggle to identify all the edge cases for linked lists, it was pretty smooth to code up.
I knew the concepts of pointers from before, but I learned how to use the debugging tools for the first time in this homework (linked lists).
I finished implementing linked lists quickly and it compiled and worked on almost all of my test cases. It ended up being a tiny bug (check your parantheses!).
